data.title: Remove workbench.action.terminal.focus in favor of workbench.action.focusPanel
Introduce a move command for the editor
data.body:
PR for #9143 

Introduce a move command for placing cursor at a logical view position in the editor.

Usage:
- Command Id: `cursorMove`
- Arguments: `{to: $viewPosition}`

Allowed view positions:
- `lineStart`: Places the cursor at the start of the current line in the view.
- `lineFirstNonWhitespaceCharacter`: Places the cursor at the first non white space character of the current line in the view.
- `lineEnd`: Places the cursor at the end of the current line in the view.
- `lineLastNonWhitespaceCharacter`: Places the cursor at the last non white space character of the current line in the view.
- `lineCenter`: Places the cursor at the center of the line in the view.

data.title: Control over snippets
data.body:
There are many different expectation wrt snippets and we should introduce some user settings and command to tackle that
- [x] add a config option to sort snippets in the suggest box like `top`, `bottom`, `inline`, `none`
- [x] **moved to separate issue** - [add a command to insert the best matching snippet suggestions](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/9579) 
- [x] add a command to only show snippet suggestions (filter on `CompletionItemKind`)

data.title: Debt - eliminate deprecated __ language configuration settings
data.body:
- Replace the deprecated configuration settings with the `language.configuration.json` file in our extensions.
- Make Pull Requests against the well known extensions that use the deprecated setting: PowerShell, Go, Python
- Document the language.configuration.json file in the extensibility reference.

data.title: extension to create task
data.body:
I am trying to develop an extention for the Titanium Mobile framework.
That extension allows you to build a project kind of like the cordova extension does.
To execute a build my extension runs a command using `shell.exec`

I would like to make my "build" a "task". The reason are :
- make my build appear as a "default task"
- use of problem matcher to detect errors
- allow the user to customize the build task?
- correct handle of keyboard shortcuts. I would like to use the same keyboard shortuct to run the default task and to build using TItanium. It makes sense because when in titatnium folder then it should build. But when in another folder (npm) it should run the default task.

I don't see anyway to do that right now. I have looked through existing extensions and no one seems to have gone that far.

I think this is a must have. This is the main reason why i still build my Titanium projects with Sublime Text.

data.title: (Feature request) Support for Multi-line template strings (backticks)
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro
## Current Behaviour:

When writing code in Typescript with Angular 2 framework, The IDE didn't recognize HTML tags in inline template with Multi-line strings (backticks), auto code formatting ignores HTML tags inside `backticks`, this situation makes code management much worse.
## Desired Behaviour:

Detection of HTML tags inside `backticks` while performing auto code formatting.

data.title: Types suddenly not being recognised after installing extension
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.1 (e6b4afa53e9c0f54edef1673de9001e9f0f547ae)
- OS Version: Windows 7

Probably can't give reproduction steps as it has nuked my environment, but I installed the `tslint` extension from the store. After doing this, VSCode started acting strange and seemed like it was ignoring `tsconfig.json`: it, for example, would not detect any typings and assumed that things like `Object.assign` didn't exist.

It was not throwing it's toys out of the pram due to syntax etc, _just_ typings.

Here's my tsconfig

```
{
  "compilerOptions": {
    "target": "es6",
    "module": "commonjs",
    "sourceMap": true,
    "sourceRoot": "./app",
    "allowJs": true,
    "noResolve": true
  },
  "include": [ "typings/index.d.ts" ],
  "files": [
    "app/boot.js"
  ]
}
```

`typings/index.d.ts` is generated from the following typings.json

```
{
  "dependencies": {
    "bluebird": "registry:npm/bluebird#3.3.4+20160531224558",
    "lodash": "registry:npm/lodash#4.0.0+20160416211519",
    "redux": "registry:npm/redux#3.0.6+20160214194820",
    "redux-thunk": "registry:npm/redux-thunk#2.0.0+20160525185520"
  },
  "globalDependencies": {
    "angular": "registry:dt/angular#1.5.0+20160602160139",
    "angular-locker": "registry:dt/angular-locker#2.0.3+20160317120654",
    "angular-sanitize": "registry:dt/angular-sanitize#1.3.0+20160317120654",
    "angular-translate": "registry:dt/angular-translate#2.4.0+20160505162438",
    "angular-ui-router": "registry:dt/angular-ui-router#1.1.5+20160521151413",
    "html": "file:.typings/html.d.ts",
    "isomorphic-fetch": "registry:dt/isomorphic-fetch#0.0.0+20160524142046",
    "jquery": "registry:dt/jquery#1.10.0+20160417213236",
    "kendo-ui-professional": "file:.typings/kendo.d.ts",
    "moment-node": "registry:dt/moment-node#2.11.1+20160511043338",
    "scss": "file:.typings/scss.d.ts",
    "ui-select": "registry:dt/ui-select#0.13.2+20160317120654",
    "url": "file:.typings/url.d.ts",
    "webpack-env": "registry:dt/webpack-env#1.12.2+20160316155526"
  }
}
```

`npm run typecheck`, which executes `tsc --noEmit` works perfectly fine.  However, I have the following `.vscode/tasks.json`:

```
{
  // See https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=733558
  // for the documentation about the tasks.json format
  "version": "0.1.0",
  "command": "tsc",
  "isShellCommand": true,
  "args": ["-p", ".", "--noEmit"],
  "showOutput": "silent",
  "problemMatcher": "$tsc"
}
```

This runs `tsc --noEmit -p .` and this seems to be causing the issue by igoring any and all typings.

I'm assuming it has something to do with `-p .`, but it makes no sense for this to randomly stop working.

FWIW, here is my `settings.json`. `typescript.tsdk` points to `typescript@beta`.

```
// Place your settings in this file to overwrite default and user settings.
{
  "editor.tabSize": 2,
  "files.exclude": {
    "**/.git": true,
    "**/.svn": true,
    "**/.DS_Store": true,
    "**/*.{pubxml,csproj*}": true,
    "**/{obj,bin}": true,
    "typings/": true,
    "node_modules/": true
  },
  "typescript.tsdk": "node_modules/typescript/lib"
}
```

Note that it would also appear that my VSCode is no longer tracking errors across the project either: It now only tracks errors when I view specific files.

data.title: VS Code creates .browse.VC.db and .browse.VC.db-wal
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.1
- OS Version: OS X 10.11.5

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a new folder in VS Code that doesn't have `.vscode` folder.

Expected Behaviour:
1. Should leave the folder as is or give notification to setup additional tools e.g. .NET Core debugger

Actual Behaviour
1. Creates a `.vscode` folder containing `.browse.VC.db` and `.browse.VC.db-wal` files.

data.title: Debug extensions on Windows is painfully slow
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0-Insider and 1.3.0
- OS Version: Windows 10 x64.
- Node.js Version: 6.3.0

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Download [VSCodeVim](https://github.com/VSCodeVim/Vim/) or [vscode-encourage](https://github.com/rebornix/vscode-encourage)
2. `npm install && npm run compile`, set breakpoints.

When I debug VSCodeVim, the breakpoint is hit but seems VS Code has a hard time requesting for variables and call stacks.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/876920/16834968/d486d28a-49e8-11e6-8344-93117b9f308e.png)

See the image above, the debug pallete shows the breakpint is already hit but no line is highlighted and the variables/call stack sections are still empty. It usually took me minutes to see the call stack.

When I debug my encourage extension, run into the same situation.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/876920/16835008/0b852e80-49e9-11e6-8a53-830c2913eb9c.png)

See the debug  pallete and call stack pane.

Previously I ran into this situation on Lenovo X1C with Windows 10 x64. Now I just set up dev env on my new Dell XPS 13 today and still see the problem. The debugging works perfectly on OSX.

Can anyone help provide me some steps to troubleshoot or gather logging about this issue?

data.title: Folding icon collides with git decorations: Create a div per linedecoration
data.body:
Motivated by issue #9222.  Pull request also contains the changes to fix #9222.

The underlying issue is that all line decorations on the same line share the same div and that css rules on that div interfere with each other. 

The fix creates a div per decoration className. The existing code already folds multiple decorations on the same line with the same class name.
The divs are still absolutely positioned, at the same location, so there's not more horizontal space used than before.

The same change could be done on the glyph margins, but I kept the existing behaviour.

Before
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6461412/16834336/9fa6a2b4-49b3-11e6-9576-de6c8c4e6403.png)

After
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6461412/16834303/815c4944-49b3-11e6-8f56-ac3210c41d8d.png)

data.title: 'revealIfOpened' flag should start at active editor
data.body:
goto declaration now uses the [`revealIfOpened` flag ](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/tree/master) but there is this issue
- have the same file open two times
- in the second slot invoke go to def on a symbol that in the file
- 🐛 the first editor is revealed
- when the reveal-flag is set the search for the editor should start at the active editor not at the beginning

data.title: Extensions don't install

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.1
- OS Version: Windows 7 Pro SP1

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Do a new clean Visual Studio Code installation
2. Try to install any extension

It stays "installing" forever and doesn't throw an error.

It could be because of domain policies, but then I think it should throw some kind of error.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10497736/16834097/98f9a76e-49b2-11e6-970f-b342d4cc3cf6.png)

(Running as an administration doesn't change the situation)

Also it should show the progress of the downloads or something, the ouput window is empty.
